title: The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: They looked out of the wide windows at the little Braid Burn trickling through the fields and at the hills beyond, so austere from everlasting that they had never been capable of losing anything by the war.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: They aredivided by a small brook, called the Braid Burn;and the more northern side, on which the spectatoris supposed to be stationed, is called BlackfordHill.

title: Within a mile o' Edinburgh Town
author: Hardy, Robina F.
snippet: Here 's a' yer healths in guid springwatter frae the Braid Burn.
